results.title: Here come the teletubbies
results.creator_credit: David G. Hillier, Vic Finch, Anne Wood, Ragdoll Productions and BBC
results.brief_description: Teletubbies is a TV show that originated on the BBC and has proven to be especially popular among younger children. Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po live in a magical land where television comes from, a land where anything can happen, and usually does. In this video, kids will find out how many things can be put in Tinky Winky’s bag and who spilled the Tubby custard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David G. Hillier, Vic Finch, Anne Wood, Ragdoll Productions and BBC

results.title: Here and there in Canada
results.brief_description: Cinemagaazine items including: Octopus Hunt: An energetic skin diver and a tranquilizer bring live octopuses to Vancouver’s public aquarium. Gently Down the Mountain: Mountain rescue techniques and equipment used by R.C.M.P. and park wardens are shown on Mt. Cirrus. Canada’s National Game: Lacrosse, a fast and furious game learned from North American Indians.

results.title: Here and now
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Julia Overton and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A demonstrator uses medical equipment to measure the immediate effects on the body of just one cigarette. The surprising results are discussed by the school students involved in the tests.

results.title: Here and now
results.brief_description:
Depression can be a disability making every day seemingly a challenge just to get through to the next day. Brendan, with help and motivation, has overcome his struggle with depression and is enjoying the here and now - working, new friends and generally feeling good about himself. “Ode to Barry” written and performed by Brendan Forde.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: Here's your bike, Ed!
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, John Taylor, Taylormade Films and Vic Roads
results.brief_description: The purpose of this title is to demonstrate a variety of skills that children need to cycle safely on roads. Designed to accompany a Bike Ed program in schools, with Teacher’s notes, there are a variety of activities and drills which will develop children’s confidence as bike riders and users of the road.

results.title: Here's to Your health: std's
results.creator_credit: Robert Grant, Craig Reardon and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: This program sets out to raise the awareness of issues regarding sexually transmitted diseases. It emphasizes the presentation of correct information and examines the transmission of STD’s and the prevention of all STD’s.

results.title: Here's to your health: skincare
results.creator_credit: Robert Grant, Craig Reardon and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: Australia has the highest rate of skin cancer in the world. This program looks at the problem of skin cancer, how to detect it and how to care for your skin when out in the sun.

results.title: Here's to your health: health for youth
results.creator_credit: Robert Grant, Craig Reardon and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
